title: Blended Teaching Method Design for Digital Citizenship Education: Strengthening Preservice Teachers' Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Focus on developing competency in designing mathematics-integrated digital citizenship education. Learners are pre-service or in-service teachers who perform self-directed learning in a smartphone-based, limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Develop an instructional design document applying the five core competencies of digital citizenship (ethical behavior, information evaluation, communication, collaboration, problem-solving) to mathematics education
Develop a gamification-based digital citizenship education module utilizing LMS and smartphones

Learners develop an evaluation rubric that measures learner engagement (attendance ≥80%, discussion participation ≥10 times), knowledge acquisition (20% improvement in pre-post test scores), and behavioral change (≥3 real-classroom application cases) when designing hybrid assessment tools, and validate its validity through peer review and expert evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
